Temnospondyls also have a stapes, which projects into the otic cavity. The stapes likely evolved from the hyomandibula of lobe @-@ finned fishes. The positioning of the stapes and the shape of the otic region suggests that the tympani of temnospondyls and frogs are homologous, but the tympani of these last - two - name chytrids seem to lack a stapes, which is apparent in the Caudata as well ( Fig. 3 ). Xancy suggests that the lack of a clear stapes in the Caudata may indicate that they have lost the ability to hear altogether. The most basal group of temnospondyls is the superfamily Edopoidea. Edopoids have several primitive or plesiomorphic features, including a single occipital condyle and a bone called the intertemporal that is absent in other temnospondyls. Edopoids include the Late Carboniferous genus Edops and the family Cochleosauridae. Dendrerpetontidae has also been included in Edopoidea, and is the oldest known temnospondyl family. Balanerpeton woodi is the oldest species, having been present over 330 million years ago during the Early Permian. Edopoids are some of the most basally branching tetrapods ; their position is marked because their arms are unlike any other tetrapods.
However, recent studies seem to suggest that temnospondyls with waterborne tadpoles and limbless terrestrial adults may instead be more closely related to the stygimolpiform temnospondyls than to all other temnospondyls ( Ruta et al. 2003 ). At any rate, there is considerable of a controversy over the classification of the basal temnospondyls. There are a few families of distinguished edopooids

Originally, temnospondyls were classified according to the structure of their vertebrae. Early forms, with complex vertebrae consisting of a number of separate elements, were placed in the suborder Rachitomi, and large Triassic aquatic forms with simpler vertebrae were placed in the suborder Stereospondyli. With the recent growth of phylogenetics, this classification is no longer viable. The basic rhachitomous condition is found in many primitive tetrapods, and is not unique to one group of temnospondyls. Moreover, the distinction between rhachitomous and stereospondylous taxa is a blurred one, as large forms, apparently rhachitomous, often possess elements in their vertebrae that appear to be stereospondylian. Why is a distinction between rhachitomous and stereospondylous taxa not a blurred one?
A. Rhachitomous effectively tasks stereospondylous.
B. A distinction between rhachitomous and stereospondylous taxa exists.
C. Rhachitomous and stereospondylous are good temporary taxonomy.
D. Taxonomy is a blurred matter for temnospondyls.
Answer: D
Explanation: A

Du Fu's work is notable above all for its range. Chinese critics traditionally used the term 集大成 ( jídàchéng- " complete symphony " ), a reference to Mencius'description of Confucius. Yuan Zhen was the first to note the breadth of Du Fu's achievement, writing in 813 that his predecessor, " united in his work traits which previous men had displayed only singly ". He mastered all the forms of Chinese poetry : Chou says that in every form he " either made outstanding advances or contributed outstanding examples ". Furthermore, his poems use a wide range of registers, from official language to colloquial idiomatic mountain dialects such as that of Shu. Even poets working in modern times such as Cai Yuanpei and Peng Pai have noted that Du Fu displays many of the characteristic features of the vernacular literature of the Warring States period, written in common idiom and marked by expressive and unstrained informality. Du Fu is also perhaps the best-known poet in all Chinese literature because of the sensibility that he represents. His is the poetic voice of national conscience. Remarketing is a method of using pin-point advertising to stay in front of known prospects, or even those who anonymously visited your website.
You’ve probably experienced remarketing when you were shopping on Amazon, then left without buying. Later that day, while you were visiting a completely different website, you saw an ad for the exact thing you were looking for on Amazon.
When someone visits a website, Google drops a “cookie” on their computer that identifies them individually. When they go on to visit another web page on Google’s network (Adwords being the largest), they are served ads that immediately start to look relevant. Those ads can include images, text, videos, and other clickable ads which bring them right back to your site.
Google calls this Remarketing, & it can be structured to be totally anonymous (personally ID’d) or anonymous tracking (no personal data gathered from a visit).
Remarketing is not an SEO thing. In fact, it actually requires some clever SEO
